title: TensorFLow Lite version for iOS through POD
body: Hi folks, Can anyone please let us know what is the latest TensorFlow lite version available for iOS through PODs. In the example, it is mentioned that the latest version for TensorFLow lite is 1.13.1. What is the latest TensorFlow lite version that we can use with TensorFlow version 2.6.0?
comments:
@mercksamir ,
Please take a look at this [link](https://www.tensorflow.org/lite/guide/build_ios) for the installation of TensorflowLite for iOS.It helps.Thanks!
@tilakrayal - Thanks but could you please confirm the latest version available for 'TensorFlowLite' for iOS and Android?

The file which you are referring to is old one and will be removed in future, for IOS examples you can check  https://www.tensorflow.org/lite/examples.
The Tensorflow Lite version you can use with TensorFlow 2.6 is  2.6. Thanks!

tf.histogram_fixed_width_bins miss input check for `nbins`
body:
**System information**
- Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in TensorFlow): Y
- OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04): Ubuntu 18.04
- Mobile device (e.g. iPhone 8, Pixel 2, Samsung Galaxy) if the issue happens on mobile device: N
- TensorFlow installed from (source or binary): binary
- TensorFlow version (use command below): 2.7.0
- Python version: 3.8
- Bazel version (if compiling from source): N/A
- GCC/Compiler version (if compiling from source):N/A
- CUDA/cuDNN version: N/A
- GPU model and memory: N/A

**Standalone code to reproduce the issue**
```
value_range = [0.0, 5.0]
new_values = [-1.0, 0.0, 1.5, 2.0, 5.0, 15]
indices = tf.histogram_fixed_width_bins(new_values, value_range, nbins=-5)
indices.numpy()
```
Outputs:
```
array([0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0], dtype=int32)
```
**Expected output**
Expected nbins to be a positive interger, and raise an error if it's negative.
comments: Hi @sachinprasadhs ! Could you please look at this issue? Attaching gist in [2.6](https://colab.sandbox.google.com/gist/mohantym/38dd66c557d5f77993144919b11f653b/github_54125.ipynb#scrollTo=fxuWOtXR_aPE) and [2.7](https://colab.sandbox.google.com/gist/mohantym/6942139dfd2218e14af74cccea8db259/github_54125.ipynb) , [2.8](https://colab.sandbox.google.com/gist/mohantym/17c5b2aa7cbf28f9b59de73a92ec858e/github_54125.ipynb#scrollTo=fxuWOtXR_aPE) for reference. Are you satisfied with the resolution of your issue? Yes No

title: Docker images for Tensorflow 2.6.2 are missing
body: TensorFlow 2.6.2 was released, but I cannot find docker images for TF 2.6.2 in docker hub. https://hub.docker.com/r/tensorflow/tensorflow/tags?page=1&name=2.6.2
comments:
Since it is similar to `Tensorflow version 2.6.1`, the docker Images for version `2.6.2` are not included in docker hub. 
You can use the equivalent Images for `2.6.2` with `2.6.1`.
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has no recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you.
@sachinprasadhs Thank you for the response!

title: Remove test that needs many more cherry-picks (already disabled)
Requires a newer version of the libclang package.
body:
We recently made some mistakes during maintaining the package `libclang` and the version v12.0.0 has been broken for some package managers like poetry (see issue https://github.com/sighingnow/libclang/issues/19).

Older versions of libclang has bugs about installed unintented files to users' `site-packages` directory.

This PR force the requirement of libclang to v13.0.0 to fix above issues.
comments: To Whom It May Concern, the dependency of `clang` was first imported in https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/commit/c211472000ff57bac7fcec9b0465cf73b37bf135, and was changed to `libclang` later in https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/commit/d89220bfa4cbbd7b671880a6df33ed6262fba026, as `libclang` includes a prebuilt `libclang.{so,dylib,dll}` in the pypi package and simplify the requirements of users' build environment.

I failed to figure out what's going wrong in the build log, could anybody help me to find the issue?

http://ml-ci.amd.com:21096/blue/rest/organizations/jenkins/pipelines/tensorflow/pipelines/github-prs-upstream-master/pipelines/AMD-ROCm-Community-CI-Build/branches/PR-54120/runs/1/nodes/6/steps/13/log/?start=0

Thanks!

> We recently made some mistakes during maintaining the package `libclang` and the version v12.0.0 has been broken for some package managers like poetry (see issue [sighingnow/libclang#19](https://github.com/sighingnow/libclang/issues/19)).
> 
> Older versions of libclang has bugs about installed unintented files to users' `site-packages` directory.
> 
> This PR force the requirement of libclang to v13.0.0 to fix above issues.

The required version of libclang has been published at https://pypi.org/project/libclang/#files

title: Add disable for depthwise-conv d9m-unimplemented exception
body:
This pull request adds the environment variable `TF_DISABLE_DEPTHWISE_CONV_DETERMINISM_EXCEPTIONS`, which, when set to `'true'` or `'1'` will disable the determinism-unimplemented exception-throwing functionality of `tf.nn.depthwise_conv2d`. The intention of this is to allow a program to run further, to discover if other determinism-unimplemented exceptions would be thrown in the absence of this exception. When this disable is activated, nondeterministic operation is, of course, extremely likely.

This environment variable is intended for debug purposes, and is related to issue [47174](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/47174) and specifically to [this comment](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/47174#issuecomment-976179644) in that issue.
comments: @gbaned, @reedwm should review.
Please re-run the checks.
Okay, hopefully that should do it.

The AMD ROCm CI build failure is definitely not related to these changes. I can't see the cause of the internal CI build failures, but I suspect that they are unrelated to these changes. @gbaned, what the best way to handle this? Shall I rebase the PR and force-push, assuming that my branch caught the tree at the bad moment? Or should someone on your side take a look at these and allow the pull to proceed?
Ignore the build failures. This should get merged soon.

title: tf.keras.metrics.get raise error for None
body:
**System information**
- Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in TensorFlow): Y
- OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04): Ubuntu 18.04
- Mobile device (e.g. iPhone 8, Pixel 2, Samsung Galaxy) if the issue happens on mobile device: N
- TensorFlow installed from (source or binary): binary
- TensorFlow version (use command below): 2.7.0
- Python version: 3.8
- Bazel version (if compiling from source): N/A
- GCC/Compiler version (if compiling from source):N/A
- CUDA/cuDNN version: N/A
- GPU model and memory: N/A

**Standalone code to reproduce the issue**
```
import tensorflow as tf
print(tf.keras.losses.get(None))
print(tf.keras.metrics.get(None)) # Fail
```
Outputs:
```
None
ValueError: Could not interpret metric identifier: None
```

**Expected output**
According to the document [tf.keras.metrics.get](https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/metrics/get?hl=en), the `identifier` is "One of None or string name of a metric function/class or metric configuration dictionary or a metric function or a metric class instance". So do we expect the output to be `None` when `identifier` is `None` like `tf.keras.losses.get`?
comments: @ArrowIntoTheSky , Please post this issue on [keras-team/keras](https://github.com/keras-team/keras/issues) repo. To know more refer to: https://discuss.tensorflow.org/t/keras-project-moved-to-new-repository-in-https-github-com-keras-team-keras/1999 There's a minor error in the source code. I am trying to fix it and created a new pr for the same. This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has no recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you. Closing as stale. Please reopen if you'd like to work on this further. Are you satisfied with the resolution of your issue? Yes No

title: Tensorflow Buildkite (CI) Broken
body:
Example failure: https://buildkite.com/bazel/tensorflow/builds/7681#4bedc5fc-2efe-401b-9aa4-f967df5f05dd

Tensorflow Buildkite seems to be broken with release Bazel.
comments:
@c-parsons ,
Looks like this issue is not related to tensorflow.Can you please try to install tensorflow for this [link](https://www.tensorflow.org/install).Thanks!
This issue is already fixed at TF's HEAD, so can be closed
Are you satisfied with the resolution of your issue? Yes No

Oh the issue caused this on Bazel CI is a missing pip package, we should fix it https://github.com/bazelbuild/continuous-integration/blob/master/pipelines/tensorflow.yml#L15
```
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'packaging'
```
Fixed at https://github.com/bazelbuild/continuous-integration/commit/30708c00ccaab6022b4320f9afa9860ab568b544
